Discord’s new “Orb” program rewards users with virtual currency for watching ads and engaging with sponsored content. Linus and Luke discuss whether this shift toward monetization is a necessary evolution… or the beginning of the end for the free chat platform.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sJk-etmp624

title: Is this the end of Discord?

China just held the world’s first humanoid robot fighting tournament, and while the tech is impressive, the drama? Not so much. Linus and Luke weigh in on the clunky punches, the human-controlled action, and how this could actually get interesting... if you added just a few rocket launchers, maybe some robot blood, or 100 duck-sized Grievouses.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sJk-etmp624

title: Robot Fight Club is Real... And It Sucks

In a surprising move, Apple has acquired its first game studio, and it’s a tiny two-person team based in Vancouver. Linus and Luke unpack the bizarre decision, what it might mean for Apple’s gaming ambitions, and whether this signals a shift toward taking games more seriously on their platforms.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sJk-etmp624

Texas has introduced a new law forcing Apple and Google to verify every user's age just to download apps. Linus tears into the privacy nightmare and logistical mess this creates, calling out the irony of “small government” advocates pushing for massive data collection. It's a Texas-sized honeypot of problems.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sJk-etmp624
